Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit his 47th home run and stole his 48th base
Tommy Edman homered for the fourth time in 24 hours
Will Smith doubled off Shawn Armstrong in the seventh and scored on Lux’s single to center, putting the Dodgers back in front, 8-7
Miller put the Dodgers in a 2-0 hole in the first
Teoscar Hernández singled and scored on Edman’s homer into the left-field pavilion on the first pitch
Smith followed with a 404-foot shot to nearly the same spot in left
Muncy came up next and sent a towering 401-foot blast to right field on his bobblehead night
Bellinger hit a three-run shot in the fifth that chased Miller and left Chicago trailing 7-6
The Cubs loaded the bases on two walks by Daniel Hudson and an error by second baseman Chris Taylor before Pete Crow-Armstrong’s RBI single tied it 7-7

Michael Kopech loaded the bases on consecutive walks to Dansby Swanson, Seiya Suzuki and former Dodger Cody Bellinger. Kopech was called for a pitch-clock violation, giving an automatic ball to Isaac Paredes, whose sacrifice fly cut Chicago’s deficit to 10-8. Suzuki was thrown out trying to steal third and former Dodger Michael Busch struck out swinging to end the game as Kopech eked out his 13th save
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers walked 10 batters, including four by starter Bobby Miller
Third baseman Max Muncy said, 'It was frustrating again, but it’s baseball. Not everything is going to be clicking at the same time'
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said, 'Tommy is otherworldly these days'
Post-Match Reflections: Alex Vesia (3-4) got the win with one inning of relief
The Cubs outscored the Dodgers 16-7 in winning the first two games. They took the season series, 4-2

The Dodgers blew a lead for the second straight game. They were ahead 3-1 on Tuesday and lost 6-3. After their big first inning Wednesday, they eventually led 7-3 only to watch the Cubs tie it in the fifth
Max Muncy said, 'We had guys battling up there and it was good to see everyone not giving up'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani moved closer to becoming the first player in major league history with 50 homers and 50 stolen bases in a season

Gavin Lux singled in the go-ahead run with two outs in the seventh inning and the Los Angeles Dodgers rallied after blowing a 7-3 lead to beat the Chicago Cubs 10-8 on Wednesday night and avoid a series sweep
The Dodgers designated hitter Shohei Ohtani (17) waits for a pitch during the first inning of a baseball game against the Chicago Cubs in Los Angeles, Wednesday, Sept. 11, 2024.
